source_sentence: 播般曩結使波(唐云步擲)金剛念誦儀　歸命金剛手　　諸佛所依者　具普賢眾行　　住是本有身　無始無終寂　　妙用施諸願　摩王順三毒　　改劫故調柔　拯救諸有情　　從凡入佛地　現世皆成就　　今演念誦義次若有比丘比丘尼優婆塞優婆夷。
translation: Pāṇḍara-kṣipa (Tang word for step-throwing), the ritual for recitation of the vajra, takes refuge in the vajra hand, the one on whom the buddhas rely, the one who possesses all the practices of Samantabhadra, who abides in this originally existent body, has no beginning and no end, and who gives his wondrous function to all his vows. King Mānavaka follows the three poisons, thus making eons of change pliable, and saves all sentient beings. From the worldling to the buddha stage, all are now accomplished in the present life.
